newsitem.title: USA: Chrysler reaches year-to-date sales record.
newsitem.headline: Chrysler reaches year-to-date sales record.

text.p: Chrysler Corp said Tuesday its U.S. year-to-date sales for 1996 reached two million units as of October 21, the earliest point in a calendar year it has reached that number.
The automaker said it had sold 2,003,949 units as of Monday. Previously, the earliest point it had reached the two million mark was November 29, both 1994 and 1988.

Chrysler's calendar year record for the U.S. is 2,208,057, which it reached in 1988. The company sold 2,164,343 vehicles in the U.S. for all of 1995. Sales so far this year are 14 percent higher than the 1995 rate.
